properties.name: Pella
properties.description: The capital of Kingdom of Macedon and the birthplace of Alexander. Now the relics becomes a museum showing the history of ancient Macedon
properties.newdescription: A village and a municipality in the Pella regional unit of Macedonia, Greece. It is located on the site of ancient Pella

properties.name: Rhacotis
properties.description: A small port and the home of sentinels who protected the Egyptian kingdom from outsider
properties.newdescription: A port city founded by Alexander the Great on 331 BC, located on the Mediterranean Sea

properties.name: Troy
properties.description: A city famous for trojan war locating on the frontline between Achaemenid Empire and the Greeks. Alexander visited it in 334 BC
properties.newdescription: The city was abandoned at around 500AD, now it is one of UNESCO World Heritage Sites

properties.name: Persepolis
properties.description: The ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire. The city was looted by Alexanderâ€™s army and a fire burned the palaces
properties.newdescription: The city suffered a gradual decline after being conquered, and now it is one of UNESCO World Heritage Sites

properties.name: Taxila
properties.description: A city with an important strategic location. The ruler of the city surrendered to Alexander in 326BC
properties.newdescription: The city was conquered by different empires several times and was abandoned in 5th century. A new Texila was built next to it and the ruins of old city is one of UNESCO World Heritage Sites
